intro: Dehaasia kwangtungensis, commonly known as the Guangdong dehaasia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
